clinical_study.brief_title: Characteristics of Mediastinal Lymph Node With False Positive FDG PET/CT Results in Lung Cancer Staging : Relation With TB and Latent TB Infection
clinical_study.official_title: Characteristics of Mediastinal Lymph Node With False Positive FDG PET/CT Results in Lung Cancer Staging : Relation With TB and Latent TB Infection

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to analyze pathologic and radiologic characteristics of mediastinal lymph nodes with false positive FDG PET/CT results in lung cancer staging and assess relationship between false positive mediastinal lymph node and TB/latent TB.

primary_outcome.measure: false positive rate of Mediastinal Lymph Node

arm_group.description: person who performed PET/CT and surgical biopsy of mediastinal lymph node for diagnosis of primary lung cancer of metastatic lung cancer

biospec_descr.textblock: whole blood for perfoming Quantiferon-TB Gold in tube assay

study_pop.textblock: person who performed PET/CT and surgical biposy of mediastinal lymph node for diagnosis of primary lung cancer of metastatic lung cancer

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- age 20-75, men and women
- person who performed PET/CT and surgical biopsy of mediastinal lymph node for diagnosis of primary lung cancer of metastatic lung cancer
Exclusion Criteria:
- age < 20
- person who don't agree with enrollment
- illiterate
- person who is diagnosed as active tuberculosis now
- person who has history of hypersensitivity on PPD (tuberculin purified protein derivative)
- pregnant woman
- person who is treated as active tuberculosis

clinical_study.keyword: mediastinal lymph node with false positive FDG PET/CT results in lung cancer staging
